revised_title: Spectral Analysis of Earths and Alkali Metals
tldr: The author, William Huggins, conducted experiments to analyze the spectra of various earths and alkali metals when exposed to the heat of the oxyhydrogen flame. He discovered that the bright lines in the spectra were due to the volatilization of compounds of the metals with oxygen. The author also found similarities in the spectra of earths and alkali metals, suggesting a connection between their chemical properties.
